svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
April 20, 2024" date: "2024-04-20"
Eth News and Links
Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade (meta EIP7600 )
* Latest all core devs â€“ consensus (ACDC) call video . Notes from Christine Kim :
Electra included EIPs : EIP7251 maxEB : changing to execution layer triggered
consolidations after pectra-devnet-0 and proposal to apply deposit to state when epoch
finalized EIP7549 move committee index outside attestation : discussion on handling
Deneb attestations at fork boundary and proposal to replace committee bits with
indices Electra proposed additions: EIP7685 general purpose execution layer requests:
consolidate request types, decide Monday on including EIP7691 blob throughput
increase: short term scaling before PeerDAS, exact values to be based on testing,
alternative to EIP7659 stepped increase Electra candidates for inclusion : EIP7547
inclusion lists : issues with EIP3074 canâ€™t be resolved for Electra Node-id mapping to
attestation subnets: clarification for mainnet & PeerDAS
Latest all core devs â€“ consensus (ACDC) call video . Notes from Christine Kim :
* Electra included EIPs : EIP7251 maxEB : changing to execution layer triggered
indices
Electra included EIPs :
* EIP7251 maxEB : changing to execution layer triggered consolidations after
pectra-devnet-0 and proposal to apply deposit to state when epoch finalized
EIP7251 maxEB : changing to execution layer triggered consolidations after
* EIP7549 move committee index outside attestation : discussion on handling Deneb
attestations at fork boundary and proposal to replace committee bits with indices
EIP7549 move committee index outside attestation : discussion on handling Deneb
* Electra proposed additions: EIP7685 general purpose execution layer requests:
alternative to EIP7659 stepped increase
Electra proposed additions:
* EIP7685 general purpose execution layer requests: consolidate request types, decide
Monday on including
EIP7685 general purpose execution layer requests: consolidate request types, decide
* EIP7691 blob throughput increase: short term scaling before PeerDAS, exact values to
be based on testing, alternative to EIP7659 stepped increase
EIP7691 blob throughput increase: short term scaling before PeerDAS, exact values to
* Electra candidates for inclusion : EIP7547 inclusion lists : issues with EIP3074
canâ€™t be resolved for Electra
Electra candidates for inclusion :
* EIP7547 inclusion lists : issues with EIP3074 canâ€™t be resolved for Electra
* Node-id mapping to attestation subnets: clarification for mainnet & PeerDAS
Node-id mapping to attestation subnets: clarification for mainnet & PeerDAS
* consensus-specs v1.5.0-alpha.0 : initial Electra spec for pectra-devnet-0
consensus-specs v1.5.0-alpha.0 : initial Electra spec for pectra-devnet-0
* Latest all core devs â€“ execution (ACDE) call video .Â Notes from Tim Beiko &
Christine Kim : Pectra upgrade (small fork targeting late 2024) EIPs added to Pectra &
will be part of pectra-devnet-0 : EIP3074 AUTH/AUTHCALL opcodes EIP2935 save
historical block hashes in state EIPs considered for inclusion : EOF: need to assess
cross client testing complexity & any potential issues with Verkle EIP7623 increase
call data cost: need to consider best mechanism to cap block size EIP7547 IL
(inclusion lists) : some opposition to including Osaka upgrade EIPs considered for
inclusion: EIP7667 raise gas costs of hash functions
Latest all core devs â€“ execution (ACDE) call video .Â Notes from Tim Beiko & Christine
Kim :
* Pectra upgrade (small fork targeting late 2024) EIPs added to Pectra & will be part
of pectra-devnet-0 : EIP3074 AUTH/AUTHCALL opcodes EIP2935 save historical block
hashes in state EIPs considered for inclusion : EOF: need to assess cross client
testing complexity & any potential issues with Verkle EIP7623 increase call data cost:
need to consider best mechanism to cap block size EIP7547 IL (inclusion lists) : some
opposition to including
Pectra upgrade (small fork targeting late 2024)
* EIPs added to Pectra & will be part of pectra-devnet-0 : EIP3074 AUTH/AUTHCALL
opcodes EIP2935 save historical block hashes in state
EIPs added to Pectra & will be part of pectra-devnet-0 :
* EIP3074 AUTH/AUTHCALL opcodes
EIP3074 AUTH/AUTHCALL opcodes
* EIP2935 save historical block hashes in state
EIP2935 save historical block hashes in state
* EIPs considered for inclusion : EOF: need to assess cross client testing complexity
& any potential issues with Verkle EIP7623 increase call data cost: need to consider
best mechanism to cap block size
EIPs considered for inclusion :
* EOF: need to assess cross client testing complexity & any potential issues with
Verkle
EOF: need to assess cross client testing complexity & any potential issues with Verkle
* EIP7623 increase call data cost: need to consider best mechanism to cap block size
EIP7623 increase call data cost: need to consider best mechanism to cap block size
* EIP7547 IL (inclusion lists) : some opposition to including
EIP7547 IL (inclusion lists) : some opposition to including
* Osaka upgrade EIPs considered for inclusion: EIP7667 raise gas costs of hash
functions
Osaka upgrade
* EIPs considered for inclusion: EIP7667 raise gas costs of hash functions
* EIP7667 raise gas costs of hash functions
Lightclient: addressing EIP3074 concerns
* Lightclient: addressing EIP3074 concerns
* EIP7251 maxEB (increase max effective balance) Breakout call video & notes : staking
providers prefer execution layer triggered consolidations (consolidations not in
pectra-devnet-0) and donâ€™t need custom ceilings
EIP7251 maxEB (increase max effective balance)
* Breakout call video & notes : staking providers prefer execution layer triggered
consolidations (consolidations not in pectra-devnet-0) and donâ€™t need custom ceilings
Osaka + F starname upgrade (meta EIP7607 )
* Verkle: Implementers call video & notes
* Implementers call video & notes
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
* ðŸš¨ Lido at 28.7% still too close to 33.3% threshold
ðŸš¨ Lido at 28.7% still too close to 33.3% threshold
* Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth ~63% majority
Consensus layer: Prysm 38% Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
* Execution layer: Geth ~63% majority
Execution layer: Geth ~63% majority
* Consensus layer: Prysm 38%
Consensus layer: Prysm 38%
* Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
* Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America &
Europe
Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America &
Layer 1
* ePBS Potuz: ePBS spec notes and ePBS forkchoice annotated spec Terence: with ePBS
you may choose to trust relayers instead of having to trust them
ePBS
* Potuz: ePBS spec notes and ePBS forkchoice annotated spec
Potuz: ePBS spec notes and ePBS forkchoice annotated spec
* Terence: with ePBS you may choose to trust relayers instead of having to trust them
Terence: with ePBS you may choose to trust relayers instead of having to trust them
* Vitalik: a concrete proposal for correlated attester penalties Vitalikâ€™s proposal
builds on Toni WahrstÃ¤tterâ€™s correlated attestation penalties analysis
Vitalik: a concrete proposal for correlated attester penalties
* Vitalikâ€™s proposal builds on Toni WahrstÃ¤tterâ€™s correlated attestation penalties
analysis
* Issuance change proposals: Minimum viable issuance creates value by reducing total
costs for users Reward curve with capped issuance , alternative to tempered issuance
Why exogenous rewards must be considered in the issuance debate
Issuance change proposals:
* Minimum viable issuance creates value by reducing total costs for users
Minimum viable issuance creates value by reducing total costs for users
* Reward curve with capped issuance , alternative to tempered issuance
Reward curve with capped issuance , alternative to tempered issuance
* Why exogenous rewards must be considered in the issuance debate
* ethPandaOps: Assertoor : cross-client integration testing tool, higher abstraction
level than Hive Tracoor : beacon data & execution trace explorer to identify & address
network problems Guide to using Kurtosis & ethereum-package to launch local devnets
ethPandaOps:
* Assertoor : cross-client integration testing tool, higher abstraction level than
Hive
Assertoor : cross-client integration testing tool, higher abstraction level than Hive
* Tracoor : beacon data & execution trace explorer to identify & address network
problems
Tracoor : beacon data & execution trace explorer to identify & address network
* Guide to using Kurtosis & ethereum-package to launch local devnets
Guide to using Kurtosis & ethereum-package to launch local devnets
* bloXroute & Lighthouse: post mortem of March issue with 13% missed slots
bloXroute & Lighthouse: post mortem of March issue with 13% missed slots
Client Releases
* Execution layer: Geth v1.13.15 : fixes to avoid snapsync-related data-corruption
* Geth v1.13.15 : fixes to avoid snapsync-related data-corruption
For Stakers
* EthStaker staking survey
Layer 2
* Arbitrum BOLD (dispute resolution protocol) live on dedicated testnet
Arbitrum BOLD (dispute resolution protocol) live on dedicated testnet
* L2BEAT Costs : breakdown of L2 transaction costs
L2BEAT Costs : breakdown of L2 transaction costs
* XEN spam is 68% of Base state
XEN spam is 68% of Base state
* Steven Goldfeder: technical & financial benefits end at L3
Steven Goldfeder: technical & financial benefits end at L3
* ZeroPool: zk native sharded storage protocol
ZeroPool: zk native sharded storage protocol
* ProoÏ† : SNARK prover market mechanism
ProoÏ† : SNARK prover market mechanism
* RollCall (L2 standards) call video
RollCall (L2 standards) call video
EIPs/Standards
* EIPs: EIP7684 : Return deposits for distinct credentials EIP7685 : General purpose
execution layer requests EIP7686 : Linear EVM memory limits EIP7688 : Forward
compatible consensus data structures EIP7691 : Blob throughput increase Meta EIP7692 :
EVM Object Format (EOF) Meta EIP7693 : Backward-compatible post-quantum migration
EIPs:
* EIP7684 : Return deposits for distinct credentials
EIP7684 : Return deposits for distinct credentials
* EIP7685 : General purpose execution layer requests
EIP7685 : General purpose execution layer requests
* EIP7686 : Linear EVM memory limits
EIP7686 : Linear EVM memory limits
* EIP7688 : Forward compatible consensus data structures
EIP7688 : Forward compatible consensus data structures
* EIP7691 : Blob throughput increase
EIP7691 : Blob throughput increase
* Meta EIP7692 : EVM Object Format (EOF) Meta
Meta EIP7692 : EVM Object Format (EOF) Meta
* EIP7693 : Backward-compatible post-quantum migration
EIP7693 : Backward-compatible post-quantum migration
* RIPs (Rollup Improvement Proposals): RIP7696 : Precompile for generic DSM (double
scalar multiplication)
RIPs (Rollup Improvement Proposals):
* RIP7696 : Precompile for generic DSM (double scalar multiplication)
* ERCs (application layer): ERC7680 : Valued tokens with layered liquidity ERC7681 :
Dual nature multi-token protocol (ERC20 & ERC1155) ERC7682 : Auxiliary funds
capability ERC7683 : Cross chain intents ( proposed by Uniswap & Across Protocol )
ERC7687 : AUTHCALL ERC4626 deposit/withdraw extension ERC7689 : Smart blobs (state
machine on top of blobs) ERC7690 : Union lock (based on TSTORE/TLOAD) ERC7694 : Solana
storage handler for CCIP-Write ERC7695 : Ownership delegation and context for NFTs
ERCs (application layer):
* ERC7680 : Valued tokens with layered liquidity
ERC7680 : Valued tokens with layered liquidity
* ERC7681 : Dual nature multi-token protocol (ERC20 & ERC1155)
ERC7681 : Dual nature multi-token protocol (ERC20 & ERC1155)
* ERC7682 : Auxiliary funds capability
ERC7682 : Auxiliary funds capability
* ERC7683 : Cross chain intents ( proposed by Uniswap & Across Protocol )
ERC7683 : Cross chain intents ( proposed by Uniswap & Across Protocol )
* ERC7687 : AUTHCALL ERC4626 deposit/withdraw extension
ERC7687 : AUTHCALL ERC4626 deposit/withdraw extension
* ERC7689 : Smart blobs (state machine on top of blobs)
ERC7689 : Smart blobs (state machine on top of blobs)
* ERC7690 : Union lock (based on TSTORE/TLOAD)
ERC7690 : Union lock (based on TSTORE/TLOAD)
* ERC7694 : Solana storage handler for CCIP-Write
ERC7694 : Solana storage handler for CCIP-Write
* ERC7695 : Ownership delegation and context for NFTs
ERC7695 : Ownership delegation and context for NFTs
Stuff for developers
* Remix v0.47.0 : adds Solidity Copilot using SolCoder LLM, pin contracts deployed to
Remix VM and DappDraft plugin to generate a front end
Remix v0.47.0 : adds Solidity Copilot using SolCoder LLM, pin contracts deployed to
* Foundry: Forge clone : create Foundry project from a verified contract Forge
verify-bytecode : verify code at a commit hash matches deployed contract OpenZeppelin
Foundry Upgrades : deploy/manage upgradeable contracts with safety checks
Foundry:
* Forge clone : create Foundry project from a verified contract
Forge clone : create Foundry project from a verified contract
* Forge verify-bytecode : verify code at a commit hash matches deployed contract
Forge verify-bytecode : verify code at a commit hash matches deployed contract
* OpenZeppelin Foundry Upgrades : deploy/manage upgradeable contracts with safety
checks
OpenZeppelin Foundry Upgrades : deploy/manage upgradeable contracts with safety checks
* Token types (Solidity): drop-in replacements for interfaces; ERC20, ERC721,
ERC721Receiver, ERC4626 & ERC6909
Token types (Solidity): drop-in replacements for interfaces; ERC20, ERC721,
* Solhint community v4 : config files per subdirectory, improved exit code handling,
saner defaults, single rule for casing & redefined recommended ruleset
Solhint community v4 : config files per subdirectory, improved exit code handling,
* Inline Yul style guide
Inline Yul style guide
* FUCK : ERC20 token implemented in Brainfuck
FUCK : ERC20 token implemented in Brainfuck
* Slither v0.10.2 : slither-mutate support for Foundry projects, unused imports
detector and supports aliases
Slither v0.10.2 : slither-mutate support for Foundry projects, unused imports detector
and supports aliases
* Cyfrin Aderyn : Solidity static analyzer, in Rust
Cyfrin Aderyn : Solidity static analyzer, in Rust
* Vyper interface scanner : detecting incorrect interface definitions
Vyper interface scanner : detecting incorrect interface definitions
* Halmos v0.1.11 (symbolic testing): adds support for ecrecover precompile, addr(key)
& sign(key, digest) cheats and makeAddr functions from forge-std
Halmos v0.1.11 (symbolic testing): adds support for ecrecover precompile, addr(key) &
sign(key, digest) cheats and makeAddr functions from forge-std
* Sub Zero : mine vanity addresses using CREATE2, tokenized as ERC721 NFTs
Sub Zero : mine vanity addresses using CREATE2, tokenized as ERC721 NFTs
* Viem experimental : adds EIP3074 sign & verify auth message and recover signing
address from auth message
Viem experimental : adds EIP3074 sign & verify auth message and recover signing
* Guide to writing efficient DuneSQL queries
Guide to writing efficient DuneSQL queries
* Sonobe experimental folding schemes library, implements Nova & CycleFold
Sonobe experimental folding schemes library, implements Nova & CycleFold
Security
* Hedgey Finance $44M exploit on Arbitrum & mainnet via missing input validation
Hedgey Finance $44M exploit on Arbitrum & mainnet via missing input validation
* Grand Base $2M exploit on Base via deployer private key compromise
Grand Base $2M exploit on Base via deployer private key compromise
* SEAL-ISAC (database of blackhat info): free membership for whitehats via application
SEAL-ISAC (database of blackhat info): free membership for whitehats via application
* Analysis of Angel drainer used in web3 phishing
Analysis of Angel drainer used in web3 phishing
Ecosystem
* Decline of public transaction pool : private RPCs & order flow auctions used to
reduce impact of MEV
Decline of public transaction pool : private RPCs & order flow auctions used to reduce
impact of MEV
* ETHDam hackathon projects
ETHDam hackathon projects
* Eth.limo architecture explainer
Eth.limo architecture explainer
Job Listings
* ChainSafe: Head of Protocol Engineering and Senior Product Manager
ChainSafe: Head of Protocol Engineering and Senior Product Manager
* EF: People Operations Support
EF: People Operations Support
* Devcon: Community Supporter , Production Magician & Volunteer Coordinator
Devcon: Community Supporter , Production Magician & Volunteer Coordinator
* Nethermind Mechanism Designer , Protocol Research Manager , Research Engineer
Nethermind Mechanism Designer , Protocol Research Manager , Research Engineer
Job listings: $600 for 4 issues (75 char limit). Pay using 3cities. Questions?
abcoathup at-gmail
Onchain stats
* Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 5.0 to 586.3 gwei, with 17.5 gwei average Zero net
issuance currently at 23.0 gwei 4.1k ETH net issuance this week
Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 5.0 to 586.3 gwei, with 17.5 gwei average
* Zero net issuance currently at 23.0 gwei
Zero net issuance currently at 23.0 gwei
* 4.1k ETH net issuance this week
4.1k ETH net issuance this week
* ETHUSD : $2,876 - $3,282, currently $3,029
ETHUSD : $2,876 - $3,282, currently $3,029
* ETHBTC : currently 0.048 (Flippening at ~0.16)
ETHBTC : currently 0.048 (Flippening at ~0.16)
Notable at app layer
* PoolTogether v5 live on Optimism, ETH prizes automatically sent, no parameter
governance & no admin controls Target Period Dutch Auction liquidation algorithm
PoolTogether v5 live on Optimism, ETH prizes automatically sent, no parameter
governance & no admin controls
* Target Period Dutch Auction liquidation algorithm
* ethOS phone : mint & burn NFT on Base to redeem for Pixel 7a with ethOS v3
ethOS phone : mint & burn NFT on Base to redeem for Pixel 7a with ethOS v3
* Ouragan : Tornado Cash offramp
Ouragan : Tornado Cash offramp
* 71.8 ETH donated to Roman Storm & Alex Pertsev legal defense fund after coordinated
jury vote for Crypto: The Game Season 2
71.8 ETH donated to Roman Storm & Alex Pertsev legal defense fund after coordinated
Regulation/business/tokens
* Uniswap Labs received Wells notice from SEC
Uniswap Labs received Wells notice from SEC
* IRS draft form 1099-DA includes unhosted wallet provider checkbox
IRS draft form 1099-DA includes unhosted wallet provider checkbox
* Mango Markets attacker Avraham Eisenberg convicted for commodities fraud & market
manipulation, sentencing scheduled for July 29
Mango Markets attacker Avraham Eisenberg convicted for commodities fraud & market
* Ethereum generated $369M profit in Q1 (daily USD value of burned ETH minus issuance)
Ethereum generated $369M profit in Q1 (daily USD value of burned ETH minus issuance)
General
* Telegram users: disable automatic media download to prevent attacks via media files
Telegram users: disable automatic media download to prevent attacks via media files
* World-Check KYC screening database illegally obtained via third party system
World-Check KYC screening database illegally obtained via third party system
* Jolt : zkVM using sumcheck protocol
Jolt : zkVM using sumcheck protocol
* Blendy : sumcheck prover
Blendy : sumcheck prover
* Greco : fast zk proofs for valid FHE RLWE ciphertexts formation
Greco : fast zk proofs for valid FHE RLWE ciphertexts formation
* Rapidsnark GPU acceleration 4x CPU
Rapidsnark GPU acceleration 4x CPU
* Families of prime-order endomorphism-equipped embedded curves on pairing-friendly
curves
Families of prime-order endomorphism-equipped embedded curves on pairing-friendly
* Mopro : simple client-side proving on mobile
Mopro : simple client-side proving on mobile
END OF SERVICE: plan to deprecate Week in Ethereum News
Editor: @abcoathup Follow @WeekinEthNews for the most clicked links Permalink:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-april-20-2024
